nodes.long_description:
SynergyXR transforms how manufacturing, energy, and industrial enterprises train, collaborate, and innovate.

Our no-code platform allows you to effortlessly create immersive virtual procedures and environments, streamlining remote support, interactive training, and critical safety protocols -all without any coding skills required. 

Scale your operations seamlessly as your business grows, improving safety, reducing costs and boosting efficiency. Easily integrate interactive 3D models, documents, and videos to craft XR experiences that drive real results. 

Download SynergyXR today and start revolutionizing your business.
nodes.short_description:
SynergyXR is the premier no-code XR platform for the manufacturing, energy, and industrial sectors. 

Quickly build, scale, and optimize immersive training and operational solutions to enhance your team’s safety, efficiency, and collaboration. Experience cutting-edge virtual tools for immersive learning, hands-on training, detailed machinery reviews and more. Free to download and explore.

nodes.long_description:
SynergyXR gives users a DIY XR toolbox that lets them easily create their own VR meeting space and add a wide range of interactive content like 3D models, pdf documents, images, and even videos.  

Users can interact with the content manager to drop content anywhere in the space. Users can also resize, place and interact with content, including playing videos and writing on virtual whiteboards. Even better, you can step inside 3D models to get a fully immersive experience.​  

SynergyXR is free to download but requires a subscription to access. For subscription options, please contact: https://www.synergyxr.com/speakwithsales
nodes.short_description:
In a world where the need for human connection has never been greater, SynergyXR is harnessing the power of XR to help people discover new ways to connect, collaborate and learn. ​​ 

Whether you need to bring your global team together for daily meetings, or need to review the design for a piece of heavy machinery, SynergyXR has you covered. 

SynergyXR is free to download but requires a subscription to access. For subscription options, please contact: https://www.synergyxr.com/speakwithsales

nodes.change_log:
Patch 3.0.1 
•	SynergyXR should now better respect proxy settings on corporate networks 
•	Various bug fixes 

Version 3.0.0
Procedures
•	The “Reset” button on the Procedure Panel, now takes the user all the way back to the start procedure screen where the language can be selected.
UI re-work
•	The entire UI has been re-built using a lighter more vibrant color scheme better matching the visual identity of SynergyXR
•	All UI elements are aligned in look and feel
•	All icons have been updated to more clearly convey what buttons does
Training Spaces
•	In-app users can select the “Training” sub menu to see all tagged training spaces
•	In this sub-menu users can also input their LMS code in case they come from a Learning Management System
Various minor improvements
•	On application start-up we provide users with an error page summarizing any mandatory online services that are currently not accessible. This is done to provide better and more concise information to the user as soon as possible.
•	All audio sources (built into the Environment and any video auto-playing) is muted until the user has fully entered the Space. This is done to avoid audio playing during loading of Spaces.

Procedures
•	The “Reset” button on the Procedure Panel, now takes the user all the way back to the start procedure screen where the language can be selected.
UI re-work
•	The entire UI has been re-built using a lighter more vibrant color scheme better matching the visual identity of SynergyXR
•	All UI elements are aligned in look and feel
•	All icons have been updated to more clearly convey what buttons does
Training Spaces
•	In-app users can select the “Training” sub menu to see all tagged training spaces
•	In this sub-menu users can also input their LMS code in case they come from a Learning Management System
Various minor improvements
•	On application start-up we provide users with an error page summarizing any mandatory online services that are currently not accessible. This is done to provide better and more concise information to the user as soon as possible.
•	All audio sources (built into the Environment and any video auto-playing) is muted until the user has fully entered the Space. This is done to avoid audio playing during loading of Spaces

2.8.1
•	Fixed various bugs in the procedure system. 
2.8.0
Measurement Tool
•	Users can add a new distance measurement to the active session
•	Users can choose between 3 different tools: Vertical, Horizontal and Free-form.
•	It is possible to change the measurement between metric and imperial units from the wrist menu. 
•	Users can adjust the measurement 
Environment Audio Control
•	When creating a custom Environment using the SynergyXR Environment Tool it is possible to integrate audio sources in the Environment
•	Users can now control the volume of these audio sources
•	All audio sources are scaled between 0% (muted) and 100% (original volume) maintaining the relative volume differences originally set in the Environment
Procedure Events
•	We introduce “Events” in our Procedures system. Events can be used to model errors in Procedures, or allow users to interact with parts of the Environment not critical to the main Procedure
•	Several events can be active at once, allowing the user to perform multiple events in parallel with the main Procedure
•	An event can be tagged as being an “error”
Procedure improvements
•	It is now possible to perform a “Two-hand assembly” allowing users to e.g. pick up an electrical screwdriver with one hand and attaching a battery using the other hand
•	We now store the Procedure state in the Space. The Procedure Panel visibility state is also saved, allowing users e.g., to start a Procedure – hide the panel – and save the Space.

Measurement Tool
•	Users can add a new distance measurement to the active session
•	Users can choose between 3 different tools: Vertical, Horizontal and Free-form.
•	It is possible to change the measurement between metric and imperial units from the wrist menu. 
•	Users can adjust the measurement 
Environment Audio Control
•	When creating a custom Environment using the SynergyXR Environment Tool it is possible to integrate audio sources in the Environment
•	Users can now control the volume of these audio sources
•	All audio sources are scaled between 0% (muted) and 100% (original volume) maintaining the relative volume differences originally set in the Environment
Procedure Events
•	We introduce “Events” in our Procedures system. Events can be used to model errors in Procedures, or allow users to interact with parts of the Environment not critical to the main Procedure
•	Several events can be active at once, allowing the user to perform multiple events in parallel with the main Procedure
•	An event can be tagged as being an “error”
Procedure improvements
•	It is now possible to perform a “Two-hand assembly” allowing users to e.g. pick up an electrical screwdriver with one hand and attaching a battery using the other hand
•	We now store the Procedure state in the Space. The Procedure Panel visibility state is also saved, allowing users e.g., to start a Procedure – hide the panel – and save the Space.

2.7.1
•	Ensure correct use of TCP for multiuser network communication.
•	Fixed issue where application hangs shortly after starting a 3D drawing.
•	Fixed issue where active object menu did not open correctly in quick AR sessions. 
•	Fixed a rare issue where an entire Training Procedure could be moved when trying to pick up an object.

2.7.0
Planned Sessions
•	Authors and Admins can now plan a session from the Web Manager through the new “Sessions” tab
•	A start and end date and time must be specified
•	Participants can be added to the Session
•	A Space must be specified
•	All participants receives an e-mail with information about the planned Session
•	When starting SynergyXR, users who have an upcoming planned Session are notified
Avatar Configurator
•	The avatar configurator has been completely reworked
•	More than 60 million combinations not counting hair color and skin tones
Avatar Personal Protection Equipment
•	Users can now add safety equipment to their avatar during a Session
•	The Equipment menu can be accessed from the wrist-menu, under “User” in the “Equipment” sub-menu
•	Users can select between different options of “Personal Protection Equipment” (PPE)
•	It is possible to integrate the use of PPE in Procedures
Active Object Menu
•	In previous versions, when selecting an object in the Session a small menu appeared in the top-right corner of the bounding box encircling the object – this is called the “Active Object Menu”
•	We have completely reworked the Active Object Menu
•	A small button appears in the far lower part of the visible area. Clicking this button, spawns the Active Object Menu in front of the user. Users can freely grab the Active Object Menu and move it around or leave it hanging in the air.
